metadata.name: Language Data Commons top level Collection (corpus)
metadata.description: RO-Crate Editor Profile that implements the language data commons RO-Crate Metadata Profile for top level collection described here: https://purl.archive.org/language-data-commons/profile#Collection

inputs.name: name
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: The name of this dataset

inputs.name: author
inputs.help: The person or organization responsible for creating this collection of data

inputs.name: publisher
inputs.help: The organization responsible for releasing this dataset

inputs.name: funder
inputs.help: Organization(s) responsible for funding the creation or collection of this dataset

inputs.name: citation
inputs.help: Associated Publications

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: An abstract of the collection. Include as much detail as possible about the motivation and use of the dataset, including things that we do not yet have properties for

inputs.name: temporalCoverage
inputs.help: The range of years of creation for items in this dataset eg 1900-1945. If there are sub collections with different coverages put this on the sub-collections not the top-level.

inputs.name: spatialCoverage
inputs.help: The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates areas that the dataset describes: a dataset Cape York languages would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the outline of the Cape.

inputs.name: hasCollectionProtocol
inputs.help: Link to a CollectionProtocol object with (at least) a summary of how resources were selected or elicited for this collection / sub-collection

inputs.name: contentLocation
inputs.help: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

inputs.name: hasMember
inputs.help: If this collection has sub-collections add them here.

inputs.name: hasPart
inputs.help: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).

inputs.name: conformsTo
inputs.help: A link to the Text Commons RO-Crate profile for collections

inputs.name: language
inputs.label: Language
inputs.help: The language(s) of the content in this Collection

inputs.help: Associated Publications

inputs.help: The name of this work

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: An abstract of the work. Include citation details.

inputs.name: author

inputs.help: The ISBN for this work, if applicable

inputs.name: issn
inputs.help: The ISSN for this publication

inputs.name: name
inputs.label: Name
inputs.help: The name of this protocol

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: An abstract of the article, include details of how to cite it.

inputs.name: author
inputs.help: The person or organization responsible for creating this collection of data

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: A summary of the collection protocol used for this collection or subcollection - eg how texts were selected, or what prompts were given to participants

inputs.name: collectionProtocolType
inputs.help: What kind of collection protocol is this

values.description: The collection protocol includes a task-based prompt to participants
values.name: ElicitationTask

values.description: A description of the criteria used to select texts in a collection
values.name: TextSelectionCriteria

inputs.name: datePublished
inputs.help: The (earliest) date the data in this dataset were created

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: The name the place

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: The description the place

inputs.name: address
inputs.help: Physical address of the place

inputs.name: geo
inputs.help: The geo coordinates of the place

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: The name the geo coordinate

inputs.name: latitude
inputs.help: The latitude of a location

inputs.name: longitude
inputs.help: The longitude of a location

inputs.name: name
inputs.help: The name the geo shape

inputs.name: box
inputs.help: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character

inputs.name: circle
inputs.help: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters

inputs.name: line
inputs.help: A line is a point-to-point path consisting of two or more points. A line is expressed as a series of two or more point objects separated by space.

inputs.name: polygon
inputs.help: A polygon is the area enclosed by a point-to-point path for which the starting and ending points are the same. A polygon is expressed as a series of four or more space delimited points where the first and final points are identical.

inputs.name: asWKT
inputs.help: The WKT serialization of the geometry

inputs.name: @id
inputs.label: Identifier
inputs.help: The URL to ORCID entry if possible or another stable URL. Failing that, use format with prefix # followed by name without any space.

inputs.name: name
inputs.label: name
inputs.help: The name the person

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: Add any additional info not covered by other properties here.

inputs.name: affiliation
inputs.label: affiliation
inputs.help: The name the person

inputs.name: name
inputs.label: name
inputs.help: The name of the organization

inputs.name: description
inputs.help: An abstract of the collection. Include as much detail as possible about the motivation and use of the collection, including things that we do not yet have properties for

inputs.name: location
inputs.help: A location for the organization (eg a city for a publisher)

inputs.name: encodingFormat
inputs.help: Media type typically expressed using a MIME format

inputs.name: size
inputs.help: Size in Bytes

inputs.name: modality
inputs.help: The mode (spoken, written, signed etc) of this resource. There may be more than one value for this property.
